title: [BUG] Blue and Red Squares appearing when mousing over turrets!
body:
Hey Everybody! 

We noticed an issue where players are seeing big blue squares when mousing over friendly turrets or bug red squares when mousing over enemy turrets.  (See picture above) We're working on a fix, but for now we have a workaround that will allow you to get rid of these giant Lego looking  blocks! 

1) Navigate to your League of Legends installation! (Normally - C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config)
2) Right-click your game.cfg file, and click Edit.
3) Find the Option that reads "Colors=16"
4) Delete the 16 and replace it with 32. It should now show "Colors=32"
5) Click File, then save.
6) Restart League of Legends.

If you're still experiencing this issue after these steps, make sure to [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so we can help you resolve this!

replies.body: The way i fixed it was going into NVIDIA Control Panel and setting Anisotropic filtering and every Antialiasing to [OFF](http://i.imgur.com/fiNMPvQ.png). After that i gone back to game and the squares dissapear. Surpsrisingly after that i've clicked the [Restore](http://i.imgur.com/JLmMpIK.png) button to check wich of those options actually fixed the squares bug and when i gone ingame, the squares weren't there, even with all NVIDIA settings Restored to default (Note that after hitting Restore button the options gone back to [ON](http://i.imgur.com/J5oT0ay.png) and [Application Controled](http://i.imgur.com/J5oT0ay.png), so i am not exactly sure how the bug fixed by doing all that... good luck to all)

this worked for me also...

and for everyone, in Nvidia control panel, under the tab Settings, it is "Manage 3d Settings".

I don't get the red and blue block only when I mouse-over turrets/towers ... I experience this whenever I mouse over anything from either team whether it's minions or enemy champions. It's incredibly annoying.

I looked inside my Config file and my Colors=32 already. I am running 780 TI's in SLI, and I know sometimes that creates graphical anomalies against the typical experience.

Any alternative ideas that might fix this issue for me?
Do you experience this issue when SLI is disabled? It's very possible that you're experiencing it due to the SLI configuration.
I have the issue also but not using SLI and have a 680 card. so its not just with SLI or with 700 series

I have GTX 770 and am not running SLI, I have this issue and have changed the setting that was 32 to 16 then back again to 32 relaunched all three times and still have the same issue. I have also made sure I have the latest video drivers.
A few players have reported success rolling back to the the NVIDIA 344.65 drivers. Could you try that out?
